import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

from Dora import Dora

source.f70f0292:
#Remove unwanted features from the data set

dora.remove_feature('Sl.No.')
dora.data
source.b6830056:
#Perform one-hot encoding for categorical variables

dora.extract_ordinal_feature('Reviews do Recommend')
dora.data
source.7c2652d3:
#Transform and create new features

dora.extract_feature('Weight', 'Ltr', lambda x: x * 2)
dora.data
source.53cffbdc:
# render plots of each feature in the data set against the output variable

dora.explore()
source.8e1c3bdf:
## plot a single feature against the output variable

dora.plot_feature('sepal_width')
source.5043c76d:
#partition training / validation data (80/20 split)
dora.set_training_and_validation()

# Assign training data 
X = dora.training_data[dora.input_columns()]
y = dora.training_data[dora.output]
source.20101c29:
# validate the model
X = dora.validation_data[dora.input_columns()]
y = dora.validation_data[dora.output]
source.62715dae: **Model Validation can be done using Dora.**
source.e94d6a34:
**Dora is an open-source python library. It is used to automate all the critical steps used exploratory data analysis. Dora makes not helps to clean the data, but also preps the data for modeling. 
**
**This notebook provides an overview of using Dora.**
source.432b7daf:
**Fit the selected model to the training data**

model_name.fit(X, y)
source.9c4b22a3:
**This is how simple it is to use Dora for data preprocessing and model building. You can use other models as well in the place of linear regression. **
There is not much literature available for Dora. For possible configuration information, refer https://github.com/NathanEpstein/Dora#config.
source.7a75bb7e: **To explore and visualize data the Iris dataset will be used.**
source.9201b861:
**Create the Dora data set and define the target variable in the data set. **

In the Wine review data set used here, "Reviews Rating" is the target variable.
source.946e91f3:
**In Dora you can impute missing values using mean of that column. You can also scale the values of the input variables.**


dora.impute_missing_values() #impute missing values
dora.scale_input_values() #scale input variables.Applicable only for numerical variables.
source.a53d6839:
**Check accuracy of the model**

model_name.score(X, y)
